answers.answer: You sound like a very mature young lady.  Excellent job describing your symptoms, and doing the urine glucose tests is very helpful.Your symptoms are certainly consistent with someone who is developing diabetes, but the urine tests are not.  However, urine tests are much less accurate than blood glucose tests for diagnostic purposes.  Best to see your primary doctor to have this evaluated.

question: I'm 16-years-old (female) and at the lighter end of an average weight, but overall healthy. For the past 1-2 weeks I have had the following symptoms:- Dry mouth and lips- Eating more- I'm not gaining any weight despite eating more, i actaully have lost 1 - 2 kg. And and inch around my hips- Leg cramps and pains- General tiredness- I get more irritated at people when I'm out- past Carpal Tunnel Syndrome has come back- sometimes I feel shakey+I have done 3 urine glucose home tests at different stages of the day and they all showed nothing.Could it be Type 1 diabetes giving the symptons, and without glucose in the urine?
title: Possible Type 1 Help
